title: European Union law
summary: European Union law is a system of rules operating within the member states of the European Union. Since the founding of the European Coal and Steel Community following World War II, the EU has developed the aim to "promote peace, its values and the well-being of its peoples".[3] The EU has political institutions, social and economic policies, which transcend nation states for the purpose of cooperation and human development.[4] According to its Court of Justice the EU represents "a new legal order of international law".[5]
